entry.title: TalentLMS
entry.summary: TalentLMS is a user-friendly learning management system designed for businesses and educational institutions. With intuitive course creation tools, customizable learning paths, and robust tracking features, it enables organizations to deliver effective training to employees, customers, and partners. Its cloud-based platform offers scalability, ease of use, and comprehensive reporting, making it an ideal solution for modern training needs.Versions: 8.0.0 P2
entry.content:
TalentLMS is a user-friendly learning management system designed for businesses and educational institutions. With intuitive course creation tools, customizable learning paths, and robust tracking features, it enables organizations to deliver effective training to employees, customers, and partners. Its cloud-based platform offers scalability, ease of use, and comprehensive reporting, making it an ideal solution for modern training needs.

Versions: 8.0.0 P2

Overview‚Äã

It is recommended that you review the TalentLMS Collections guide before proceeding with this blog.

Connector Settings‚Äã

Steps

  1. Login to RSA Identity G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to AFX > Connectors.
  3. Click on Create Connector and select the RESTful Web Service connector template.
  4. Enter the details as shown below under General tab.

  5. Click on the Settings tab and enter the required connection details.

  6. Click OK.

Supported Verbs‚Äã

Create an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Account‚úîÔ∏èAccount Name${AccountTemplate.Name}Unique identifier for the user
LastName‚úîÔ∏èLast Name${AccountTemplate.LastName}Family name of the user
FirstName‚úîÔ∏èFirst Name${AccountTemplate.FirstName}Given name of the user
Password‚úîÔ∏è üîíInitial Account Password${AccountTemplate.Password}Password which is required for login
Email‚úîÔ∏èEmail Address${AccountTemplate.Email}Primary email address of user

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Output Parameters
Defaults
Command Code
Generate SessionToken
MethodPOST
Pathapi/v1/usersignup
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/json
Acceptapplication/json
Request Body
{
    "first_name": "${FirstName}",
    "last_name": "${LastName}",
    "email": "${Email}",
    "login": "${Account}",
    "password": "${Password}",
    "status": "active"
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression$.error.type
(.*)Error Type: $1
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression$.error.message
(.*)Error Message: $1
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Add Account to Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Add Account to Group and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
AccountID‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${Account.External_Id}Unique identifier for the user
GroupKey‚úîÔ∏èGroup Key${Group.External_Id}Unique key for the group

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Code
Generate SessionToken
MethodPOST
Pathapi/v1/addusertogroup
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/json
Acceptapplication/json
Request Body
{
    "user_id": ${AccountID},
    "group_key": "${GroupKey}"
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression$.error.type
(.*)Error Type: $1
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression$.error.message
(.*)Error Message: $1
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Remove Account from Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Remove Account from Group and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
AccountID‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${Account.External_Id}Unique identifier for the user
GroupKey‚úîÔ∏èGroup Key${Group.External_Id}Unique key for the group

entry.title: Active Directory
entry.summary: Active Directory (AD) is a Microsoft directory service that manages network
entry.content:
Active Directory (AD) is a Microsoft directory service that manages network resources efficiently. It centralizes authentication, authorization, and network management tasks, providing a unified environment for user and computer management. AD simplifies IT administration, enhances security through access controls, and facilitates seamless communication across a network, making it a crucial component for enterprise environments.

Versions: 8.0.0 P1

Connector Settings‚Äã

Steps

  1. Login to RSA Identity G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to AFX > Connectors.
  3. Click on Create Connector and select the Active Directory connector template.
  4. Enter the details as shown below under General tab.

  5. Click on the Settings tab and enter the required connection details.

  6. Provide the DN settings as show below.

  7. If Create Account verb with dynamic OU placement is required, DN Suffix Mappings1 can be configured as show below. In the example below, US is the country code from HR source and OU=US,OU=Users,DC=company,DC=com is the desired OU for account placement.1Ô∏è‚É£

  8. Click OK.
  9. Verify the settings using Test Connector Settings option.

Supported Verbs‚Äã

Create an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter*Display NameMappingDescription
Account‚úîÔ∏èAccount Name${AccountTemplate.Name}Full distinguished name
sAMAccountName‚úîÔ∏èsAMAccountName${AccountTemplate.Name}Logon name used to support clients and servers running earlier versions of the operating system, such as Windows NT 4.0, Windows 95, Windows 98, and LAN Manager
CN‚úîÔ∏èCommon Name${AccountTemplate.CN}Name that represents an object. It is used to perform searches
sn‚úîÔ∏èLast Name${AccountTemplate.LastName}Surname of a person
givenName‚úîÔ∏èFirst Name${AccountTemplate.FirstName}A given name of a person
mailEmail Address${AccountTemplate.Email}Simple SMTP address of a person
Password‚úîÔ∏è üîíInitial Account Password${AccountTemplate.Password}Password which is required for login
userAccountControlUser Account Control(UAC)NORMAL_ACCOUNTUser Account Control(UAC) Value
displayNameDisplay Name${AccountTemplate.LastName}, ${AccountTemplate.FirstName}The display name for the user
userPrincipalNameUser Principal Name${AccountTemplate.UPN}User Logon Name

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Below are some additional input parameters that are required in special situations.

ParameterDescription
AFX_DN_Suffix_Key1Set this value of the HR attribute(s) or any other key that will identify the OU where the user account will be created. When configured, if no match is found the account will be created in the default OU configured in the connector.

Refer to DN Suffix Mappings in the connection settings. If country is the key for picking OU, the mapping will look something like this ${AccountTemplate.Country} 1Ô∏è‚É£

Command Output Parameters

Parameter NameDisplay NameMappingDescription
distinguishedNameDistinguished NameAccount.External_IDA distinguished name (DN) is a LDAP entry that uniquely identifies and describes an entry in a directory
1Ô∏è‚É£

Using output parameters is crucial when certain values are unknown before the process begins. In this specific scenario, where the Organizational Unit (OU) is not known in advance, capturing the distinguishedName as an output parameter is essential. distinguishedName becomes vital for subsequent operations, such as Add Account to Group.

Additional Use Cases

üü† Dynamic DN‚Äã

During the account creation the account can be placed in specific Organizational Units (OU) dynamically based on one or more attributes from the HR sources or key passed through account template.

Examples

  • Place users in OUs based on country code from HR system.
  • Place users in OUs based on the department and office location attributes collected from HCM.

Solution

  1. Add DN Suffix Mappings in the Settings tab.
  2. Add AFX_DN_Suffix_Key1 to the Create Account verb.
  3. Read the distinguishedName output parameter in the Create Account verb.

Items marked by 1Ô∏è‚É£ in this blog are related to this use case.

üü† Change Password on First Logon‚Äã

When creating a new account, it may be necessary for users to change their password during their initial login. This can be accomplished by configuring specific input parameters within the Create Account verb.

The input parameters required are as follows:

ParameterDescription
_AFX_FORCE_REGISTER_USER_CHANGE_PWD- When it is set to 0, the pwdLastSet attribute of the new account will be set to the date/time when the account is created (i.e. the user does not have to set the password at the next logon).
- When it is set to 1, the pwdLastSet attribute of the new account will be set to 0 (i.e. the user must set the password at the next logon).
pwdLastSetSetting to 0 along with userAccountControl to NORMAL_ACCOUNT,PASSWORD_EXPIRED will set the User must change password at next logon on the Active Directory account. This attribute stores the value of the date and time when the user's password was last changed in Windows NT.

This is an alternative solution to setting _AFX_FORCE_REGISTER_USER_CHANGE_PWD

Add Account to Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter*Display NameMappingDescription
User2‚úîÔ∏èAccount DN or Account Name${Account.External_Id}Full distinguished name of user or user name
Group2‚úîÔ∏èGroup DN or Group Name${Group.External_Id}Full distinguished name of group or group name

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

  1. Click OK. 4. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Remove Account from Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter*Display NameMappingDescription
User2‚úîÔ∏èAccount DN or Account Name${Account.External_Id}Full distinguished name of user or user name
Group2‚úîÔ∏èGroup DN or Group Name${Group.External_Id}Full distinguished name of group or group name

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Create a Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create a Group and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter*Display NameMappingDescription
Group2‚úîÔ∏èGroup DN or Group NameFull distinguished name of group or group name
CN‚úîÔ∏èCommon NameName that represents an object. It is used to perform searches
sAMAccountNamesAMAccountNameLogon name used to support clients and servers running earlier versions of the operating system, such as Windows NT 4.0, Windows 95, Windows 98, and LAN Manager
groupType‚úîÔ∏èGroup Type-2147483646Set of flags that define the type and scope of a group. (-2147483646 - Security Group type)

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

üî¥ üü† ‚ö´ ‚ö™ üü£ üü¢ üü° üîµ

CON004

Footnotes‚Äã

  1. Both the parameter name AFX_DN_Suffix_Key (or AFX_OU_Picker) as well as the key used in the DN mappings are case sensitive. Example : If the DN mapping is US=OU=US,OU=Users,DC=company,DC=com then the expected value is US. Us or us will not match the mapping rule. ‚Ü© ‚Ü©2 ‚Ü©3

  2. In the absence of full distinguished name for user or group, the user or group distinguished name will be calculated based on the corresponding base DN specified in the Settings tab. ‚Ü© ‚Ü©2 ‚Ü©3 ‚Ü©4 ‚Ü©5

entry.title: Eletive
entry.summary: Eletive is a People Success Platform that gathers real-time employee engagement
entry.content:
Eletive is a People Success Platform that gathers real-time employee engagement surveys, performance management, OKR goal-setting, 360-feedback, and 1:1s in one intuitive and user-friendly tool. Eletive automates and streamlines tedious admin tasks, so HR, managers, and team members can focus on the business goals.

Versions: 7.5.2

Connector Settings‚Äã

Steps

  1. Login to RSA Identity G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to AFX > Connectors.
  3. Click on Create Connector and select the RESTful Web Service connector template.
  4. Enter the details as shown below under General tab.

  5. Click on the Settings tab and enter the required connection details.

  6. Click on Add More Parameters.
  7. Enter the details for APIKey as shown below and click OK.

  8. Provide the API key in the API Key field and click OK.

    .

Supported Verbs‚Äã

Create an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Account‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${AccountTemplate.Name}A unique identifier used to reference users
LastName‚úîÔ∏èLast Name${AccountTemplate.LastName}Family name of the user
FirstName‚úîÔ∏èFirst Name${AccountTemplate.FirstName}Given name of the user
Email‚úîÔ∏èEmail Address${AccountTemplate.Email}Primary email address of user
ManagerIDManager ID${AccountTemplate.ManagerID}A unique identifier used to reference user's supervisor
ManagerEmailManager Email Address${AccountTemplate.ManagerEmail}Primary email address of user's supervisor
EmpTypeEmployee Type${AccountTemplate.EmpType}Used to identify the relationship between the organization and the user.
CountryCountry${AccountTemplate.Country}The user's country (ISO 3166 ‚Äî Country Codes)

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Output Parameters
Parameter NameTypeDisplay NameMappingDescription
ExternalIDStringExternal IDAccount.Name A unique identifier used to reference users within Eletive
Command Code
Generate SessionToken
MethodPOST
Pathv1/scim2/Users
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/json
Accept*/*
AuthorizationBearer ${Settings.APIKey}
Request Body
{
  "schemas": [
    "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User",
    "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:eletive:2.0:User"
  ],
  "externalId": "${Account}",
  "userName": "${Email}",
  "name": {
    "familyName": "${LastName}",
    "givenName": "${FirstName}"
  },
  "emails": [
    {
      "type": "work",
      "value": "${Email}",
      "primary": true
    }
  ],
  "locale": "en",
  "preferredLanguage": "en",
  "userType": "Users",
  "active": true,
  "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:extension:eletive:2.0:User": {
    "participateInSurvey": true,
    "Manager": {
      "email": "${ManagerEmail}",
      "externalId": "${ManagerID}"
    },
    "Country": "${Country}",
    "Email": "${Email}",
    "userType": "${EmpType}"
  }
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d{2}$0
^([45])\d{2}$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^(.{0,3})Response code: $1
Detailed Response
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^(.{0,3})Response code: $1
ExternalID
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionid
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Enable an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Enable an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Account‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${Account.External_Id}A unique identifier used to reference users

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Code
Generate SessionToken
MethodPATCH
Pathv1/scim2/Users/${Account}
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/json
Accept*/*
AuthorizationBearer ${Settings.APIKey}
Request Body
{
  "schemas": [
    "urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:PatchOp"
  ],
  "Operations": [
    {
      "op": "add",
      "path": "active",
      "value": true
    }
  ]
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d{2}$0
^([45])\d{2}$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^(.{0,3})Response code: $1
Detailed Response

  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Disable an Account‚Äã

Steps

  2. Click on Disable an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Account‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${Account.External_Id}A unique identifier used to reference users

entry.title: Microsoft Dynamics 365
entry.summary: Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a comprehensive cloud-based business application
entry.content:
Microsoft Dynamics 365 is a comprehensive cloud-based business application suite integrating ERP, CRM, and AI-driven insights. It streamlines operations, enhances customer engagement, and provides data-driven decision-making for businesses of all sizes, fostering growth and efficiency.

Versions: 7.5.2

Overview‚Äã

In an earlier blog, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Collections we looked into collecting accounts and entitlements from Microsoft Dynamics 365. In this article, we will discuss provisioning into Microsoft Dynamics 365 using REST APIs.

Connector Settings‚Äã

Steps

  1. Login to RSA Identity G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to AFX > Connectors.
  3. Click on Create Connector and select the RESTful Web Service connector template.
  4. Enter the details as shown below under General tab.

  5. Click on the Settings tab and enter the required connection details.

  6. Click on Add More Parameters.
  7. Enter the details for scope as shown below and click OK.

  8. Provide the https://instance.dynamics.com/.default offline_access in the Scope field.
  9. Click on Get OAuth 2.0 Access Token and authorize.
  10. Click OK.

Supported Verbs‚Äã

Login‚Äã

üí°Note

If your setup requires the client credentials flow of OAuth, it is advised to use the Login verb.

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Login and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameDescription
ClientID‚úîÔ∏èClient IDClient ID for the API access
ClientSecret‚úîÔ∏è üîíClient SecretSecret corresponding to the Client ID

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Output Parameters
Defaults
Command Code
MethodPOST
Pathhttps://login.microsoftonline.com/TENANT_ID/oauth2/token
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Request Body
grant_type=client_credentials&client_id=${ClientID}&client_secret=${ClientSecret}&Resource=https://instance.dynamics.com/
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
Session Token
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionaccess_token
  1. Click OK. 4. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Create an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Email‚úîÔ∏èEmail Address${AccountTemplate.Email}Primary email address of user
UserID‚úîÔ∏èUserID${AccountTemplate.Account_Name}The unique identifier for the user
UserName‚úîÔ∏èUser Name${AccountTemplate.UserName}The name associated with the user
AliasAlias${AccountTemplate.Alias}An alternative name or nickname for the user
AccountTypeAccount Type${AccountTemplate.AccountType}The type of account associated with the user
NetworkDomainNetwork Domain${AccountTemplate.CostCenter}The network domain associated with the user

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Output Parameters
Parameter NameTypeDisplay NameMappingDescription
AccountNameStringAccount NameAccount.NameAccount name for the new user
Command Code
Generate SessionToken‚úîÔ∏è
MethodPOST
Path/data/SystemUsers
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Acceptapplication/json; charset=utf-8
AuthorizationBearer ${SessionToken}
Request Body
{
  "UserID": "${UserID}",
  "UserName": "${UserName}",
  "Email": "${Email}",
  "UserInfo_language": "en-us",
  "Helplanguage": "en-us",
  "Alias": "${Alias}",
  "AccountType": "${AccountType}",
  "NetworkDomain": "${NetworkDomain}",
  "Enabled": "true"
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1

Pattern
SUCCESSShouldn't match

(.*)Failed ($1)

AccountName
Expression TypeStatus Code
Expression

  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

  2. Click on Delete an Account and configure as shown below.

  2. Click on Add Application Role to Account and configure as shown below.

entry.title: MangoApps
entry.summary: MangoApps is a versatile collaboration platform that enables organizations
entry.content:
MangoApps is a versatile collaboration platform that enables organizations to streamline communication and enhance productivity. It offers a comprehensive suite of features, including instant messaging, file sharing, task management, and team collaboration tools. With its intuitive interface and robust functionality, MangoApps empowers teams to connect, share ideas, and work together seamlessly across departments and geographies.

Versions: 7.5.2

Overview‚Äã

In an earlier blog, MangoApps Collections we looked into collecting accounts and entitlements from MangoApps. In this article, we will discuss provisioning into MangoApps using REST APIs.

Connector Settings‚Äã

Steps

  1. Login to RSA Identity G&L console as System Administrator.
  2. Navigate to AFX > Connectors.
  3. Click on Create Connector and select the RESTful Web Service connector template.
  4. Enter the details as shown below under General tab.

  5. Click on the Settings tab and enter the required connection details.

  6. Click OK.

Supported Verbs‚Äã

Login‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Login and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameDescription
Username‚úîÔ∏èUsernameService account user name
Password‚úîÔ∏è üîíPasswordPassword for the service account
ClientID‚úîÔ∏èClient IDClient ID for the API access
ClientSecret‚úîÔ∏è üîíClient SecretSecret corresponding to the Client ID

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Output Parameters
Defaults
Command Code
MethodPOST
Pathoauth2/token.json
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Request Body
client_id=${ClientID}&client_secret=${ClientSecret}&grant_type=password&username=${Username}&password=${Password}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionerror
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionerror_description
Session Token
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionaccess_token
  1. Click OK. 4. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Create an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Create an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Email‚úîÔ∏èEmail Address${AccountTemplate.Email}Primary email address of user
FName‚úîÔ∏èFirst Name${AccountTemplate.FirstName}A given name of a person
LName‚úîÔ∏èLast Name${AccountTemplate.LastName}Surname of a person
EmployeeID‚úîÔ∏èEmployee ID${AccountTemplate.EmployeeID}User's employee ID in the organization
TitleTitle${AccountTemplate.Title}Job title for the user
CostCenterCost Center${AccountTemplate.CostCenter}User's cost center

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Output Parameters
Defaults
Command Code
Generate SessionToken‚úîÔ∏è
MethodPOST
Pathapi/v2/websync/users.json
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Acceptapplication/json; charset=utf-8
AuthorizationBearer ${SessionToken}
Request Body
{
   "email" : "${Email}" 
   "firstName" : "${FName}" 
   "lastName" : "${LName}" 
   "usertype" : "Network User" 
   "title" : "${Title}" 
   "employeeid" : "${EmployeeID}" 
   "costcenter" : "${CostCenter}" 
   "teammemberstatus" : "Member" 
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionmessage
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
Status Code
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
Content
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
Message
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
Detail
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Add Account to Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Add Account to Group and configure as shown below.
info

The MangoApps APIs to add account to group does not support passing account name (email) and hence we cannot use this in conjunction with Create Account. Create account does not return account ID and hence will have to wait for data collection.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
AccountId‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${Account.External_Id}Unique identifier for the user
GroupId‚úîÔ∏èGroup ID${Group.External_Id}Unique identifier for the group

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Code
Generate SessionToken‚úîÔ∏è
MethodPUT
Pathapi/groups/${GroupId}/members/manage.json?send_member_list=false
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Acceptapplication/json; charset=utf-8
AuthorizationBearer ${SessionToken}
Request Body
{
  "ms_request": {
    "group": {
      "add_member_ids": [
        "${AccountId}"
      ],
      "generate_feed": "Y"
    }
  }
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionmessage
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Remove Account from Group‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Remove Account from Group and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
AccountId‚úîÔ∏èAccount ID${Account.External_Id}Unique identifier for the user
GroupId‚úîÔ∏èGroup ID${Group.External_Id}Unique identifier for the group

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Code
Generate SessionToken‚úîÔ∏è
MethodPUT
Pathapi/groups/${GroupId}/members/manage.json?send_member_list=false
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Acceptapplication/json; charset=utf-8
AuthorizationBearer ${SessionToken}
Request Body
{
  "ms_request": {
    "group": {
      "remove_member_ids": [
        "${AccountId}"
      ],
      "generate_feed": "Y"
    }
  }
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionmessage
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

Update an Account‚Äã

Steps

  1. Edit the connector and navigate to Capabilities tab.
  2. Click on Update an Account and configure as shown below.

Command Input Parameters

Parameter Name*Display NameMappingDescription
Email‚úîÔ∏èEmail Address${User.Email}Primary email address of user
FNameFirst Name${User.FirstName}A given name of a person
LNameLast Name${User.LastName}Surname of a person
EmployeeIDEmployee ID${User.EmployeeID}User's employee ID in the organization
TitleTitle${User.Title}Job title for the user
CostCenterCost Center${User.CostCenter}User's cost center

üîí = Encrypted ‚úîÔ∏è = Required

Command Code
Generate SessionToken‚úîÔ∏è
MethodPOST
Pathapi/v2/websync/users.json
Request Headers
Content-Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded
Acceptapplication/json; charset=utf-8
AuthorizationBearer ${SessionToken}
Request Body
{
  "email": "${Email}",
  "firstName": "${FName}",
  "lastName": "${FName}",
  "usertype": "Network User",
  "title": "${Title}",
  "employeeid": "${EmployeeID}",
  "costcenter": "${CostCenter}",
  "teammemberstatus": "Member"
}
Status Code
Expression TypeStatus Code
Pattern
^[23]\d2$0
^([45])\d2$$1
Brief Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expressionmessage
Detailed Response
Expression TypeJson Path
Expression
  1. Click OK.
  2. Run the Test Connector Capabilities to verify the verb.

References‚Äã

  • MangoApps Homepage
CON001
